title: Dark Mode Design
content:
Dark mode design has become increasingly popular, offering users a low-light alternative that can reduce eye strain and save battery life on OLED screens. Implementing an effective dark mode requires careful consideration of color, contrast, and usability.

Key Considerations

  • Color Palette: Adjust your color scheme for dark backgrounds
  • Contrast: Ensure sufficient contrast for readability
  • Hierarchy: Maintain visual hierarchy in dark mode
  • Consistency: Keep the user experience consistent between light and dark modes

Best Practices

  1. Don't simply invert colors; design specifically for dark mode
  2. Use dark grays instead of pure black for less eye strain
  3. Reduce the overall number of colors used
  4. Test your design in various lighting conditions
  5. Provide an easy way for users to switch between modes
